intro: Corydalis alata, commonly known as the winged corydalis, is a flowering plant native to regions of Asia, including China, Korea, and Japan. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant features slender, ascending stems with lanceolate leaves that are typically hairy. Its flowers are borne in clusters and have two distinct lobes that give the plant its common name. Corydalis alata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
